components.description: A person with arms crossed forming an ‘X’ to indicate ‘no’ or ‘no good’. This motion is used on the TV game show Deal or No Deal to indicate ‘No Deal’.
components.title: Face with No Good Gesture

components.description:
Zero Width Joiner (ZWJ) is a Unicode character that joins two or more other characters together in sequence to create a new emoji.

Zero Width Joiner, pronounced "zwidge", is not an emoji and has no appearance by itself. This is an invisible character when used alone.

View Emoji ZWJ Sequences that use this character.
components.title: Zero Width Joiner

components.description: A circle shown with a diagonal arrow pointing out the top-right, used as a representation for men.
components.title: Male Sign

description: A woman with arms crossed forming an ‘X’ to indicate ‘no’ or ‘no good’. This motion is used on the TV game show Deal or No Deal to indicate ‘No Deal’. Intended to be gender-neutral but shown as a woman on most platforms.
title: Man Gesturing No

emoji_net_data.definition: The male version of the ??¬†Face With No Good Gesture emoji. The Man Gesturing NO emoji is a sequence of the ?? Face With No Good Gesture, ?  http://emojipedia.org/man-gesturing-not-ok/
emoji_net_data.name: man gesturing NO

bn:00104562a: Contrary to or forbidden by law, especially criminal law.
Prohibited by law or by official or accepted rules
Not conforming to, permitted by, or recognised by law or rules.
Contrary to or forbidden by law.

bn:00107314a: Quantifier; used with either mass nouns or plural count nouns for indicating a complete or almost complete lack or zero quantity of

bn:00088732v: To express something by a gesture or gestures.
To say or express through gestures.
Show, express or direct through movement
To show, express or direct through movements.

bn:00086877v: To tell not to do something.
To forbid, disallow, or proscribe; to make illegal or illicit.

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

bn:00040336n: The use of movements, especially of the hands, to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
A gesture is a form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication in which visible bodily actions communicate particular messages, either in place of, or in conjunction with, speech.
Form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication
A quick movement of a finger or pen on a screen that the computer interprets as a command, rather than as a mouse movement, writing, or drawing.
The use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the man gesturing 'no' presents a clear and emphatic stance with a subtly rounded face and a determined expression. His arm is raised with an open palm, a universal sign for negation, all depicted with Apple's hallmark 3D shading and smooth gradients that give him a solid, approachable appearance. The realistic lighting accentuates the gesture, conveying polite refusal, disagreement, or a firm boundary in a friendly and easily understood manner.
